title: Department of Mathematics  · Angelo State University
description: Learn about Angelo State University’s Department of Mathematics, offering undergraduate and graduate degrees in mathematics and related fields.

headings: Faculty Receive TTUS Chancellor’s Council Distinguished Teaching & Research Awards, May 3
paragraphs: Celebrate the beauty and complexity of numbers as you learn the real-world knowledge and skills to be successful in a wide variety of career fields.

In our department, you will gain valuable experience in mathematical principles, abstract thinking and problem solving. These are skills that will help you advance in virtually any career setting, or go on to graduate school.
Refer to theUndergraduate Catalogfor a full list of Minors and their requirements.

For high school mathematics teachers who want to teach high school dual-credit courses or advance to teach at the two-year or community college level, theDepartment of Curriculum and Instructionoffers aMaster of Arts in Curriculum and Instruction - Professional Educationdegree. The Mathematics concentration for this program requires students to take 18 hours ofMathematics Graduate Courses.
Scholarship opportunities got Angelo State on Uvalde native Tressa Reading’s radar, and then a campus visit convinced her to join the Ram Family.

Mathematics is a fascinating field of study that touches many aspects of our lives. Your ASU degree is your path to becoming an independent thinker with skills that are valuable across many fields, especially the sciences. It will also help you quickly get up to speed in other industries, including economics, finance, computer applications, and even medicine.
Take a look at some other aspects of our department that make ASU an outstanding place to study mathematics.
Gain valuable hands-on experience by acting as a grader or class assistant, or as a tutor in our Math Lab. You can also work on research projects or independent study with your professors.
For over 20 years, our students have maintained a 100% pass rate on the Texas Examination of Educator Standards (TExES) teacher certification test for secondary mathematics.

You can join our chapters of the Mathematical Association of America and Pi Mu Epsilon national mathematics honor society for networking, professional development and social events as you really get to know your fellow students and professors.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

“Knowing that I’m going to graduate from ASU without any debt gives me incredible peace of mind. I just feel very blessed to have received these opportunities.”

Tressa Reading, Mathematics, Pre-Health Professions Program, Class of 2024

“Because of the scholarships, I’m not constantly worried about working to support myself or pay for college. I can invest that time and effort into extracurricular activities.”

Tressa Reading, Mathematics, Pre-Health Professions Program, Class of 2024

“I like how everyone is treated in the Math Lab. Students who need help are comfortable enough to come in without being judged, even if they don’t know the simple math.”

Alexis Washington, Mathematics

“Professor Codi Jaynes truly was a light in my life. She took the time to pour into me and worked one-on-one with me when I didn’t understand something. She wanted to see me succeed!”

Tyler Ing, Class of 2025

“I chose Angelo State because opportunities are for everyone.”

Alexis Washington, Mathematics

“The Math Lab is a comfortable place if you need help. You can come in and we won’t judge you.”

Alexis Washington, Mathematics
